Come, and let us return unto the LORD: for he hath torn, and he will heal us; he hath smitten, and he will bind us up.
After two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up, and we shall live in his sight.

Then shall we know, <FI>if<Fi> we follow on to know the LORD: his going forth is prepared as the morning; and he shall come unto us as the rain, as the latter <FI>and<Fi> former rain unto the earth.<CM>
O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? for your goodness <FI>is<Fi> as a morning cloud, and as the early dew it goeth away.<RF>goodness: or, mercy, or, kindness<Rf>

Therefore have I hewed <FI>them<Fi> by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of my mouth: and thy judgments <FI>are as<Fi> the light <FI>that<Fi> goeth forth.<RF>and…: or, that thy judgments might be, etc<Rf>
For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
But they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.<RF>men: or, Adam<Rf>
Gilead <FI>is<Fi> a city of them that work iniquity, <FI>and is<Fi> polluted with blood.<RF>polluted: or, cunning for<Rf>

And as troops of robbers wait for a man, <FI>so<Fi> the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.<RF>by…: Heb. with one shoulder, or, to Shechem<Rf><RF>lewdness: or, enormity<Rf>
I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there <FI>is<Fi> the whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
Also, O Judah, he hath set an harvest for thee, when I returned the captivity of my people.<CM>
